org.springframework.cloud.dataflow.core.dsl

Class Tokens

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.cloud.dataflow.core.dsl.Tokens

  • public class Tokens
extends Object
    Class that converts an expression into a list of tokens. Furthermore, this class provides methods to process the tokens and keeps track of the current token being processed.
    Author:
    Andy Clement, Patrick Peralta

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Indicate that the current token has been successfully processed.

      Return the expression string converted to tokens.

      Return an immutable list of tokens

      Return true if there are more tokens to process.

        Return the expression string converted to tokens.

        expression string

        Decrement the current token position and return the new position.

        Return the current token position.

      • getTokenStream

        public List<Token> getTokenStream()
        Return an immutable list of tokens
        Returns:
        list of tokens

      • lookAhead

        protected boolean lookAhead(int distance,
                            TokenKind desiredTokenKind)
        Return true if the token in the position indicated by position + distance matches the token indicated by desiredTokenKind.
        Parameters:
        distance - number of token positions past the current position
        desiredTokenKind - the token to check for
        Returns:
        true if the token at the indicated position matches desiredTokenKind

      • hasNext

        protected boolean hasNext()
        Return true if there are more tokens to process.
        Returns:
        true if there are more tokens to process

      • peek

        protected Token peek()
        Return the token at the current position. If there are no more tokens, return null.
        Returns:
        token at current position or null if there are no more tokens

      • peek

        protected Token peek(int howFarAhead)
        Return the token at a specified distance beyond current position. If that is off the end of the list of known tokens, return null.
        Parameters:
        howFarAhead - how many character positions to peek ahead.
        Returns:
        token at specified distance beyond current position or null if there are no more tokens

      • peek

        protected boolean peek(TokenKind desiredTokenKind)
        Return true if the indicated token matches the current token position.
        Parameters:
        desiredTokenKind - token to match
        Returns:
        true if the current token kind matches the provided token kind

      • next

        protected Token next()
        Return the next Token and advance the current token position.
        Returns:
        next Token

      • eat

        protected Token eat(TokenKind expectedKind)
        Consume the next token if it matches the indicated token kind; otherwise throw CheckPointedParseException.
        Parameters:
        expectedKind - the expected token kind
        Returns:
        the next token
        Throws:
        CheckPointedParseException - if the next token does not match the expected token kind

      • eat

        protected Token eat()
        Consume the next token. Throw CheckPointedParseException if there is nothing to consume.
        Returns:
        the next token
        Throws:
        CheckPointedParseException - if there are no more tokens

      • isNextAdjacent

        protected boolean isNextAdjacent()
        Return true if the first character of the token at the current position is the same as the last character of the token at the previous position.
        Returns:
        true if the first character of the current token matches the last character of the previous token

      • checkpoint

        protected void checkpoint()
        Indicate that the current token has been successfully processed.
        See Also:
        lastGoodPosition

      • raiseException

        protected void raiseException(int position,
                              DSLMessage message,
                              Object... inserts)
        Throw a new CheckPointedParseException based on the current and last successfully processed token position.
        Parameters:
        position - position where parse error occurred
        message - parse exception message
        inserts - variables that may be inserted in the error message

      • getLine

        public int getLine(Token token)
        Parameters:
        token - the token for which to determine the line
        Returns:
        which line the token is on, starting from 0
